thoughts.text: It looks like the 'lsof' command is not installed on the system. We need to install it before we can use it to investigate which files are in use and cannot be moved.
thoughts.reasoning: The error message suggests that the 'lsof' command is not installed on the system. We need to install it before we can use it to investigate which files are in use and cannot be moved.
thoughts.plan: - Install the 'lsof' command on the system
thoughts.criticism: We should have checked if the 'lsof' command was installed on the system before trying to use it. This would have prevented the error we encountered.
thoughts.speak: The 'lsof' command is not installed on the system. We need to install it before we can use it to investigate which files are in use and cannot be moved.

args.command_line: sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install lsof
